title: [BUG] Incorrect behavior of sparse matrix-matrix multiplication
body_html:
This PyTorch bug was introduced by #4707.
Unlike claimed there, indices should not only be unique, but also be sorted in coalesced matrix for correct behavior of matrix multiplication. This raises a major issue when performing matrix multiplication with coalesced then transposed matrix.

The following is tested on 2e156f3, but any version after 5e72d7a will have the same behavior.

import torch
idx = torch.LongTensor([[0,1,2], [2,1,0]])
val = torch.ones(3)
D = torch.sparse.FloatTensor(idx,val,torch.Size([3,3]))
Dc = D.coalesce()
x = torch.ones((3,1))
torch.mm(D.t(), x)
 1
 1
 1
[torch.FloatTensor of size (3,1)]

torch.mm(Dc.t(), x)
 3
 0
 0
[torch.FloatTensor of size (3,1)]

I will create a pull request regarding this and #6171 later today.

body:
This PyTorch bug was introduced by https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/4707. 
Unlike claimed there, `indices` should not only be unique, but also be sorted in coalesced matrix for correct behavior of matrix multiplication. This raises a major issue when performing matrix multiplication with coalesced then transposed matrix. 

The following is tested on 2e156f3, but any version after https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/5e72d7af136eb5a9105b501923f68d1246fa90b1 will have the same behavior. 

```python
import torch
idx = torch.LongTensor([[0,1,2], [2,1,0]])
val = torch.ones(3)
D = torch.sparse.FloatTensor(idx,val,torch.Size([3,3]))
Dc = D.coalesce()
x = torch.ones((3,1))
```

```python
torch.mm(D.t(), x)
```    
     1
     1
     1
    [torch.FloatTensor of size (3,1)]

```python
torch.mm(Dc.t(), x)
```    
     3
     0
     0
    [torch.FloatTensor of size (3,1)]


I will create a pull request regarding this and https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/6171 later today.
